citation.article-title: Adhaeribacter aerophilus sp. nov., Adhaeribacter aerolatus sp. nov. and Segetibacter aerophilus sp. nov., isolated from air samples
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Segetibacter aerophilus sp. nov.
Segetibacter aerophilus (ae.ro.phi′lus. Gr. n. aer air; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. masc. adj. aerophilus air-loving).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-stain-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods that are 0.9–1.1 μm in diameter and 3.0–6.3 μm in length.
Colonies are smooth, circular, convex and yellowish after 4 days at 30 °C on R2A agar.
Good growth occurs on R2A agar and nutrient agar.
Growth occurs at 15–30 °C and with 0–1 % NaCl.
Does not hydrolyse casein, chitin, hypoxanthine, Tween 40, Tween 80, tyrosine or xanthine.

Positive (in API 20NE and API ZYM strips) for hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin, β-galactosidase (substrate p-nitrophenyl β-d-galactopyranoside), alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-mannosidase, and negative for glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, nitrate reduction, indole production, lipase (C14), trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase and α-fucosidase.
Does not assimilate any of the carbohydrates tested (API 20NE and API ID 32GN).
The predominant isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 1 G and iso-C15 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 38.4 mol%.
The type strain, 6424S-61T (=KACC 14119T =NBRC 106135T), was isolated from an air sample from Suwon, Republic of Korea.
